medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the previous morning, started as diffuse pain but progressed to greater pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The patient presented to the hospital's ED around 3 am. Reports chills and rigors, inability to keep food down, but had normal bowel movements and has been passing flatus. Currently without peritoneal signs but notable abdominal distention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, varicose veins, hyperlipidemia, chronic liver disease (stable with elevated baseline LFTs), past surgical history of varicose vein stripping and surgical repair of complex right thumb laceration with tendon repair.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for prostate cancer in father, stroke in father, and dementia in mother. No family history of diabetes, hypertension, or heart disease.
